Quick search

Enter search terms or a module, class or function name.

EMAparallel¶

Created on 21 dec. 2010

Code author: jhkwakkel <j.h.kwakkel (at) tudelft (dot) nl>

calculator pool adapted from the pool provided in multiprocessing. This version is based on the python 2.6 version.

multiprocessing logging ideas based on code examples found on StackTrace: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/641420/how-should-i-log-while-using-multiprocessing-in-python

the implementation here allows the user to not be bothered with many of the details of multiprocessing. For example, logging will work the same regardless of whether multiprocessing is used. The process class here modifies the _logger in EMAlogging to refer to the logger for its particular subprocess

class EMAparallel.CalculatorPool(modelStructureInterfaces, processes=None, callback=None, kwargs=None)¶

Class representing a pool of processes that handles the parallel calculation heavily derived from the standard pool provided with the multiprocessing library

apply_async(case, policy)¶

Asynchronous equivalent of apply() builtin

runExperiments(cases, policies)¶

convenient function to wrap around the apply assync function
